meanings.sent1: After making a mistake, he decided to restrike the nail to fix it.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith had to restrike the metal to shape it properly.
meanings.sent3: Trying to hammer the nail in with his eyes closed, he had to restrike it multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The thunder seemed to restrike the same spot over and over, echoing through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to carefully restrike the brush on the canvas to create the perfect stroke.

meanings.definition: A new impression or printing of a coin or medal using the original die
meanings.sent1: The collector was excited to add the rare restrike of the coin to his collection.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed the restrike of the ancient coin next to the original.
meanings.sent3: Seeing the restrike of the coin, the child thought it was a magical duplicate.
meanings.sent4: The restrike of the medal gleamed under the museum lights, catching everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The restrike of the coin was so detailed that it looked just like the original.

meanings.sent1: After failing the first time, she made a restrike at solving the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The team's coach encouraged them to give it their all in the restrike of the game.
meanings.sent3: In a restrike to impress his crush, he tried to juggle oranges but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: With a restrike of determination, she tackled the challenging obstacle course.
meanings.sent5: The student made a restrike at studying for the exam, hoping for a better result this time.
